page.title: 16Dalkeith Palace
page.content:
Dalkeith Palace was built in 1705. In these days it was used for the Dukes house. When it was built the Duke of Buccleuch gave it to Anne the Duchess. The Duke had intended it for her use. The house was very expensive but the Duke being nobility could afford these luxuries. The building is now part of local history and British history.
The Duke who is a rich man is the largest landowner next to the Queen. Nowadays the Duke does not use the property. It is available for commercial use. At the moment it is lying vacant, its most recent occupants, a computer company having moved out. It is not open to the public, but the Duke hopes to let it to another company or to subdivide it for flats in the near future.
